Mr, Phelps was then called on to address the meeting,
but he stated that his Report contained every thing in the
shape of information which he felt prepared to give to the
Convention'
Mr. Blanciiard also declined to address the meeting,
for a similar reason.
Judge Overton then presented the following resolutions, which were adopted:
rrrr
Resolved, That a Committee of five members of this Convention \k

appropriate address on the subject of this railroad, and its proposed and promised connection and extension by the State of Texas westwardly.
Resolved, That the same Committee be charged with preparing memorials
to the Congress of the United States, and to the Legislature of this State,
asking for grants of land along the proposed route, or other assistance in aw
of this enterprizc.

members contending that the number proposed was to"
